meanings.definition: Clothing or garments worn as a covering.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful vesture to the party.
meanings.sent2: The king's vesture was adorned with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent3: The vesture of the scarecrow made the birds laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her vesture of confidence shone brightly in the room.
meanings.sent5: The vesture of the knight fluttered in the wind as he rode into battle.

meanings.definition: To clothe or dress in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: He decided to vesture himself in traditional attire for the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The stylist vesture the model in elegant evening wear.
meanings.sent3: The magician vesture the rabbit in a tiny top hat.
meanings.sent4: She vesture her words in kindness, even when she was upset.
meanings.sent5: The artist vesture the canvas in vibrant colors, bringing it to life.
